meanings.definition: cabezones (noun): plural of cabezón, meaning someone who is stubborn or has a big head
meanings.sent1: The cabezones in the group refused to change their minds.
meanings.sent2: The teacher found it challenging to deal with the cabezones in the class.
meanings.sent3: The cabezones insisted on taking the longer route to the park, just because.
meanings.sent4: His cabezones caused him to miss out on many opportunities in life.
meanings.sent5: The cabezones' refusal to compromise led to a stalemate in negotiations.

meanings.definition: cabezones (adjective): stubborn or having a big head
meanings.sent1: She was being cabezones when she refused to admit her mistake.
meanings.sent2: The cabezones attitude of the boss made it hard for employees to suggest new ideas.
meanings.sent3: Even the cat seemed cabezones when it refused to move from its spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: His cabezones behavior was like a wall, impossible to break through.
meanings.sent5: The cabezones refusal to listen led to misunderstandings and conflicts.
